cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who played the judge in good will hunting
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: 
To answer the question, I need to recall the cast of the movie "Good Will Hunting." The film features several notable characters, and one of them is a judge who plays a significant role in the story. The judge is involved in the legal proceedings concerning the main character, Will Hunting. I will think about the actors who were part of the film and identify who portrayed the judge.

Answer: The judge in "Good Will Hunting" was played by actor Stellan Skarsgård.

who played the judge in good will hunting

Written by Affleck and Damon, the film follows 20-year-old South Boston janitor Will Hunting, an unrecognized genius who, as part of a deferred prosecution agreement after assaulting a police officer, becomes a client of a therapist and studies advanced mathematics with a renowned professor. Through his therapy sessions, Will re-evaluates his relationships with his best friend, his girlfriend, and himself, facing the significant task of confronting his past and thinking about his future.\n', 'The 1997 drama film "Good Will Hunting" follows the story of autodidact Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon. Hunting demonstrates his breadth and depth of knowledge throughout the film but especially to his therapist and in a heated discussion in a Harvard bar.\n', 'BULLET::::- In the 1997 movie "Good Will Hunting", the main character, Will Hunting, when arguing for himself in court against the dismissive rebuttals of the prosecuting attorney, cites obscure case law, then follows up by stating "Ibid, your Honour."\n', 'The protagonist of the 1997 film "Good Will Hunting", played by Matt Damon, was a working class genius from South Boston.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Good Will Hunting" (1997) – Janitor and super-genius Will Hunting (Matt Damon) begins to turn his life around with the help of psychologist (Robin Williams) and a Fields Medal-winning professor (Stellan Skarsgård).\n', 'BULLET::::- Will Hunting, protagonist of the 1997 film "Good Will Hunting"\n', 'When Will Hunting from the movie Good Will Hunting is being choked by Sean Maguire, you can see the spine of the book "I\'m OK, You\'re OK" in the bookcase that Will is being pinned against \n', 'BULLET::::- "Good Will Hunting" (Chuckie Sullivan)\n', 'In October 2016, Shalansky was asked by friend John Krasinski to join the cast in a staged reading of the Oscar Award-winning screenplay "Good Will Hunting". Shalansky joined Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, John Krasinski, Emily Blunt, Daveed Diggs, Tom McCarthy, Keegan-Michael Key, Margo Martindale and Harvey Weinstein at the NYU Skirball theater in New York City.\n']

question_info.question: who played the judge in good will hunting
passages:
BULLET::::- "Good Will Hunting" (1997) as Judge George H. Malone
Good Will Hunting is a 1997 American drama film, directed by Gus Van Sant, and starring Robin Williams, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Minnie Driver, and Stellan Skarsgård. Written by Affleck and Damon, the film follows 20-year-old South Boston janitor Will Hunting, an unrecognized genius who, as part of a deferred prosecution agreement after assaulting a police officer, becomes a client of a therapist and studies advanced mathematics with a renowned professor. Through his therapy sessions, Will re-evaluates his relationships with his best friend, his girlfriend, and himself, facing the significant task of confronting his past and thinking about his future.
The 1997 drama film "Good Will Hunting" follows the story of autodidact Will Hunting, played by Matt Damon. Hunting demonstrates his breadth and depth of knowledge throughout the film but especially to his therapist and in a heated discussion in a Harvard bar.
BULLET::::- In the 1997 movie "Good Will Hunting", the main character, Will Hunting, when arguing for himself in court against the dismissive rebuttals of the prosecuting attorney, cites obscure case law, then follows up by stating "Ibid, your Honour."
The protagonist of the 1997 film "Good Will Hunting", played by Matt Damon, was a working class genius from South Boston.
BULLET::::- "Good Will Hunting" (1997) – Janitor and super-genius Will Hunting (Matt Damon) begins to turn his life around with the help of psychologist (Robin Williams) and a Fields Medal-winning professor (Stellan Skarsgård).
BULLET::::- Will Hunting, protagonist of the 1997 film "Good Will Hunting"
When Will Hunting from the movie Good Will Hunting is being choked by Sean Maguire, you can see the spine of the book "I'm OK, You're OK" in the bookcase that Will is being pinned against 
BULLET::::- "Good Will Hunting" (Chuckie Sullivan)
In October 2016, Shalansky was asked by friend John Krasinski to join the cast in a staged reading of the Oscar Award-winning screenplay "Good Will Hunting". Shalansky joined Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, John Krasinski, Emily Blunt, Daveed Diggs, Tom McCarthy, Keegan-Michael Key, Margo Martindale and Harvey Weinstein at the NYU Skirball theater in New York City.
